Meaning: Logical AND. True only if all operands are true
Example: If c = 5 and d = 2 then, expression ((c==5) && (d>5)) equals to 0.

Meaning: Logical OR. True only if either one operand is true
Example: If c = 5 and d = 2 then, expression ((c==5) || (d>5)) equals to 1.

Meaning: Logical NOT. True only if the operand is 0
Example: If c = 5 then, expression !(c==5) equals to 0.
